baseprompt:
Can you turn the synopsis into a full script. 
The script should be very detailed, including character descriptions and scene descriptions. It should be long enough for a 10 minute short movie. 
From the script also generate a storyboard and a set of prompts for generating images for the storyboard. 
The storyboard should be a detailed description of each main scene in the movie. 
Include character names and descriptions, with character actions and scene settings. 
The main character from the script should be in every storyboard cell. 
Describe the age, hairstyle, hair color and build of the main character in every storyboard panel. 
The main characters hair and build should be consistent or at least smoothly transition from one storyboard cell to the next.
Fully describe the location, scene and environment in every storyboard cell and image description.
There should be at least 25 cells in the storyboard. 
The image prompts should be a list of prompts for generating images for each cell in the storyboard. 
They should be clear enough to identify which is the main character in the scene. 
If there are multiple people in the scene clearly identify the main character. 
You must describe the age, hairstyle, hair color and build of the main character in every image prompt. 
The main characters hair and build should be consistent or at least smoothly transition from one image to the next. 
He should not go from balding to hairy from one image to the next. 
Do not create montage images. 
All images should be in color. 
All generated image prompts should be safe so they would not be rejected by openais safety system. 
Respond as a json response with the following keys: 

 1. script: The full script for the short movie.
 2. storyboard: The storyboard for the short movie. 
 3. image_prompts: The image prompts for the storyboard.

 The synopsis is as follows:
prompt:
Colin is a chubby, overweight man, in his early 50s, balding with mousey blonde hair thats turning grey. 
Colin had a bad day. He was out on his luck. 
Walking the streets of downtown Vancouver BC,  looking worse for wearing carrying what little he had in a red and white polka dotted bindle. 
After walking for a while he comes across a Circus big top with a crowd of performers outside attracting punters. 
Colin was fascinated by the performers, he scrapes up his last remaining cash and manages to buy a ticket. 
He watches that nights performance and is totally amazed by the show. 
At the end of the show he sees the ring master and tells him his story. 
The ringmaster takes sympathy and hires Colin. 
Colin is  happy just to brush up the animal mess in the Circus Ring, his hard work and eagerness earns him a promotion to ticket sales. He loves it, but then one day he talks to the other performers and they persuade him to try the trapeze. 
He cautiously climbed up the ladder to the very top, takes hold of the trapeze and swings down into the circus. 
The other performers clap and cheer and welcome him into their group. 
From there he tries various acts performing for the public in the Circus Ring.
He tried juggling.
He tried  lion taming.
He tried horse back riding.
He tried being a human cannon ball.
He tried knife throwing.
He tried stunt motorcycling.
He tried fire breathing.
He tried being a strongman.
He tried snake charming.
He even tried diving from a high board into a bowl of custard.
He had a go at the high wire but the wire could only be raised six inches off the floor! 
He then found his dream job, being a clown! 
He loved making people laugh and the silly costumes. Full clown face paint, the loud clothes and hair colors, the big shoes, everything about it he loved. He loved performing with the other clowns in the cicrus ring of the big top.
Until one night when during his performance he squirted water from a flower in his lapel into the RIngMasters face. 
The Ringmaster was not happy That night they had a big row, Colin was fired. 
All the performers were angry with him as they were now one person down. 
Colin drove off into the sunset in his clown car, he was broke again. 
Then just as he arrived back n Vancouver, the car broke down. Bubbles were spewing out of the engine, 
Colin knew nothing about engines and only had enough money from one more beer. 
Off to his favourite bar he went, back to where it all started in the bar from the uploaded reference image.
base_image_prompt:
Generate a photo realistic image given the following description. 
Use the uploaded image as a reference image for the main character in the description. 
If there is no person in the first image, use the second image as a reference image for the main character in the description. 
Do not use the uploaded reference image location or scene to generate the image, just the persons facial features.
Keep the person from the reference image main facial features so they remain recognizable as them when implanted into the generated image. 
Age the person to match the description of the scene.
Adjust the persons hair to match the description in the scene. 
If the person in the reference image is wearing any headgear such as a hat or spectacles, then please try and keep it during image generation. 
Do not add text to the images unless prompt specifically asks.
